Summum bonum, or, An explication of the divine goodness in the words of the most renowned Boetius translated by a lover of truth and virtue. De consolatione philosophiae. English Boethius, d. 524. Elys, Edmund, ca. 1634-ca. 1707.
[12], 207 p.
Printed by H. Hall, for Ric. Davis, Oxford : 1674.
Translated by Edmund Elys. Running title: The consolation of philosophy. The first-[fourth] booke. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
